Generation II.Gold: When spotted, this Pok é mon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
Generation II.Silver: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
Generation II.Crystal: It hides deep inside caves where no light ever reaches it and remains virtually motionless there.
Generation II.Stadium 2: When spotted, this Pok é mon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail. Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It travels by digging through the ground. Diglett and Dunsparce share one another's tunnels happily.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon's tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.
Generation VIII.Shield: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
